channel.title: No-IP problems
channel.description:
Hi, I did everything I needed to do in order to set up a No-IP server. I have the message "Error connecting to server. Server must be down."
Source[b](Check)[/b] Registered in No-IP.com[b](Check)[/b] Created a host[b](Check)[/b] Portforwarded[b](Check)[/b] Compile & Run[b](Check)[/b]
Login/Test[b](Failed)[/b]
What's happened?

item.title: No-IP problems
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

I don’t use any IP but sure, go ahead and use “localhost”. =/

Yeah, other people need the No-IP domain to connect through though.

Read full topic

item.title: No-IP problems
item.dc:creator: @Timothay Timothay
item.description:
@Timothay wrote:

You use No-ip if you want people to connect to it. For you; to connect to your own server, use the server IP as:

127.0.0.1

I think that’s correct.

Read full topic

item.title: No-IP problems
item.dc:creator: @gunztheduel gunztheduel
item.description:
@gunztheduel wrote:

[quote=".Kaboom, post:5, topic:100011"][quote author=gunztheduel link=topic=143583.msg1371661#msg1371661 date=1180107998]

You don’t need to use any IP when connecting to the server;You can just login through the localhost. Also, you’ll need to have the No-IP DUC open.

How do I log in through the ‘localhost’? What’s No-IP DUC?
[/quote]

No-IP DUC is the client needed to run the actual No-Ip. And just type “Localhost” In the IP Bar…[/quote]

OK, so I can type “localhost” as the IP server. But people have to type my no-ip address right?

Read full topic

item.title: No-IP problems
item.dc:creator: @The_Wise_Guy .Kaboom
item.description:
@The_Wise_Guy wrote:

[quote=“gunztheduel, post:3, topic:100011”][quote author=I Br3ndan I link=topic=143583.msg1371658#msg1371658 date=1180107845]
You don’t need to use any IP when connecting to the server;You can just login through the localhost. Also, you’ll need to have the No-IP DUC open.
[/quote]

How do I log in through the ‘localhost’? What’s No-IP DUC?[/quote]

No-IP DUC is the client needed to run the actual No-Ip. And just type “Localhost” In the IP Bar…

Read full topic

item.title: No-IP problems
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

To login through the localhost, you do what I said.

I Br3ndan I:

You don’t need to use any IP when connecting to the server;You can just login through the localhost. Also, you’ll need to have the No-IP DUC open.

Also, if you’d have made a No-IP domain you would have downloaded the No-IP DUC.

Read full topic
